: : Darkangel : :

Darkangel looks out a window at the landscape of Earth. He sighs, thinking about the coming troubles.

Darkangel: This certinely changes the balance of things...


Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:
Tyrael: You're right. And if now we are stuck with to of them, then 
it can get worse... I hate this twist of events...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> 
> Darkangel: I think we need to find out as much about this bot as we 
can, quickly. He's too strong for me to feel safe.
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Tyrael was amazed. For a single bot to manage what he could not 
do... 
> impressive!
> 
> Tyrael: I am afraid I know nothing about this... visitor of yours. 
I 
> will look at what I can do, then, if we need to do something, I 
will 
> contact you.
> 
> He closed the line.
> 
> Tyrael: Your opinion, Darkangel?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > Hydras:
> > 
> > "I was visited by a impertitnent bot and we have a... sever 
> > fight"replied Hydras"This bot's signature didn't match with any 
> > register signature that I have... I wonder if you has been 
visited 
> > too or if you have an idea what's going here... 'cause I have the 
> > feeling that something big and dangerous it's around"
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Tyrael was about to explain himself when Hydras's voice boomed 
in 
> > the 
> > > speakers.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: Stay with me, Darkangel. I'll just get done with him 
and 
> > then 
> > > I'll explain. (Opening communication) Hydras, what can I do for 
> > you?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > : : Darkangel/DeathStar : :
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel smiled behind his faceplate, taking pride in being 
> > named 
> > > sub-commander. He winked at Dreadplague before she left, then 
> > quickly 
> > > followed Commander Tyrael.
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel: I take it you theory spell possible doom for us 
all?
> > > > 
> > > > DeathStar walked along side Dreadplague.
> > > > 
> > > > DeathStar: There was, but I'm unsure of what has come of him.
> > > > 
> > > > Once outside the base, DeathStar changed to starfighter mode, 
> > > flying towards the unknown signatures.
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Tyrael: I have a vague hypothesis... too fearsome to speak of 
> > here. 
> > > I 
> > > > don't want to believe in it, but it seems to be the only one 
> > > > possible...
> > > > 
> > > > He stopped. His face was grave and his eyes showed fear. The 
> > Blue 
> > > > Phoenix, afraid?!
> > > > 
> > > > Tyrael: Dreadplague, Deathstar, go investigate the two 
> > signatures 
> > > at 
> > > > these coordinates. If they are hostiles, do NOT engage. I 
want 
> > only 
> > > > data for now. Darkangel, I need your assistance and your 
> advice. 
> > > You 
> > > > are now officially my Second in command. Follow me please.
> > > > 
> > > > He left the room and went to the lab.
> > > > 
> > > > Dreadplague was wide eyed.
> > > > 
> > > > Dreadplague: Congratulations, Angel! We'll have to celebrate 
> > when I 
> > > > come back... (she had said that low enough that only 
Darkangel 
> > had 
> > > > heard) Come Deathstar. Let's do this and be done. Oh, by the 
> > way, 
> > > > wasn't there someone with you?
> > > >
